5.1.name: Information security policies
5.1.description: A set of policies for information security should be defined, approved by management, published and communicated to employees and relevant external parties.
controls: Review of the information security policy

5.2.name: Information security roles and responsibilities
5.2.description: All information security responsibilities should be clearly defined and allocated.

6.1.name: Internal organization
6.1.description: A management framework should be established to initiate and control the implementation and operation of information security within the organization.

6.2.name: Mobile device policy
6.2.description: Security measures should be implemented to manage the risks introduced by using mobile devices.

7.1.name: Human resource security
7.1.description: Security responsibilities should be addressed prior to employment, during employment, and after employment.

7.2.name: During employment
7.2.description: All employees and contractors should be aware of information security threats and concerns, their responsibilities and liabilities.
controls: Information security awareness, education and training

7.3.name: Termination and change of employment
7.3.description: Security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment should be defined, communicated to the employee or contractor and enforced.

8.1.name: Asset management
8.1.description: Assets should be identified and an inventory of all important assets should be drawn up and maintained.

8.2.name: Information classification
8.2.description: Information should be classified according to the security needs of the organization.

8.3.name: Media handling
8.3.description: Appropriate procedures should be implemented for the handling and storage of information to protect it from unauthorized disclosure or misuse.

9.1.name: Access control
9.1.description: Access to information and information processing facilities should be controlled on the basis of business and security requirements.
controls: Management of secret authentication information of users
Removal or adjustment of access rights

9.2.name: User access management
9.2.description: Formal user registration and de-registration procedures should be implemented to enable assignment of access rights.

9.3.name: User responsibilities
9.3.description: Users should be made aware of their responsibilities for maintaining effective access controls.
controls: Access control to program source code

9.4.name: System and application access control
9.4.description: Access to systems and applications should be controlled by a secure log-on procedure.
controls: Access control to program source code

10.1.name: Cryptographic controls
10.1.description: Cryptographic controls should be used to protect the confidentiality, authenticity and/or integrity of information.
controls: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls

11.1.name: Physical and environmental security
11.1.description: Secure areas should be used to protect information processing facilities.
controls: Protecting against external and environmental threats

12.1.name: Operational security
12.1.description: Operational procedures and responsibilities should be established and maintained.
controls: Separation of development, testing and operational environments

13.1.name: Communications security
13.1.description: Networks should be managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.

14.1.name: System acquisition, development and maintenance
14.1.description: Security should be built into information systems.
controls: Securing application services on public networks

15.1.name: Supplier relationships
15.1.description: Security requirements for mitigating the risks associated with supplier's access to the organization's assets should be agreed with the supplier.

16.1.name: Incident management
16.1.description: Events and information security incidents should be reported and managed.
controls: Assessment of and decision on information security events

17.1.name: Business continuity management
17.1.description: Information security continuity should be embedded in the organization's business continuity management systems.
controls: Verify, review and evaluate information security continuity

18.1.name: Compliance
18.1.description: The organization should avoid breaches of legal, statutory, regulatory or contractual obligations related to information security.
controls: Identification of applicable legislation and contractual requirements
